review_blob: Appearance - near opaque black body, tan coloured fine-bubbly head, fades slowly. Aroma - rich nose has dessert sweetness, bold roasty chocolate, fresh ground coffee, cream, marshmellow, fresh hops, vanilla. Palate/Flavour - body has medium-full presence and weight, slick mouthfeel with a touch of graininess, flavours very much like the nose, very good balance between the sweet/bitter, the chocolate/coffee/cream, roasty creamy desserty finish. Overall - another delicious dessert brew; you cant go wrong with the Southern Tier Blackwater Series

Appearance - body is a solid midnight black, dense foamy beige head stays. Aroma - nose is roasty and creamy, dark vinous fruits, burnt caramel, bitter chocolate, vanilla, notes of yeast, some candy hops. Palate/Flavour - body has big presence, a medium-light foamy/creamy mouthfeel, roasty flavours, fruit, bitter chocolate, coffee, some candy, a long lasting toasty chocolate/dark fruit finish.

Appearance - clear brassy-golden body, moderate fine-bubbly white head. Aroma - nice big nose, has bite, pronounced citrus & piney hops, sweet caramel, honey, touch of fresh wood, spice. Palate/Flavour - soft foamy body, some tangy bite, medium presence, flavours reflect the nose, great balance, cloying woody hoppy finish. Overall - an IIPA of great flavour and balance, and perilously easy to drink for 10%.

Appearance - pours a slick pitch-black, small light brown head. Aroma - nose has a fair bit of sweetness, is buttery, noticeable oak, vanilla, roasty caramel, with underlying dark chocolate, ground coffee, maple syrup. Palate/Flavour - nice slick body, surprisingly medium-light, fine foamy texture, flavours predominently of oak, coffee, vanilla, with bitter chocolate, a buttery oaky finish.

Appearance - body is clear, a nice deep burnt orange colour, fine bubbly off-white head. Aroma - nose is big, yeasty, with tart fruits, grainy, a bit bready, touch of candy and spice. Palate/Flavour - body is light, medium-full, fluffy and creamy, tart, lots of yeast, fruit spices, a cloying tart yeasty finish.

Appearance - very dark near opaque cherry red colour, light brown bubbly head. Aroma - lovely nose, quite roasty and hoppy, dark fruits, a bit vinous, bitter chocolate. Aroma - lovely nose, quite roasty and hoppy, dark fruits, a bit vinous, bitter chocolate. Palate/Flavour - body has medium-light weight, medium presence, creamy and sticky, flavours much like the nose, is nice and hoppy, touches of soy sauce, like a porter and IPA in one, a cloying hoppy vinous finish.
beer_name: Flying Monkeys Netherworld Cascadian Dark Ale

review_blob: Appearance - body is a smooth pitch black, fine-bubbly light brown head. Aroma - nose is big and roasty, rich, chocolate, maple syrup, toffee, port notes, a bit of alcohol burn, presence of resiny hops. Palate/Flavour - body is smooth, fluffy, surprisingly soft & light, syrupy toffee balanced well by bitter chocolate, coffee, brown sugar, leaves a light lingering toffee and bitter coffee finish.

Appearance - pours a cloudy deep burnt golden colour, medium white creamy/foamy head. Aroma - nose is fairly hoppy, tart fruits, subtle grainy malts, some dryness. Palate/Flavour - pretty big body, medium-light weight, creamy, tart tangy hops, fruity, dry malt somewhere in there, tart dry hoppy finish.

Appearance - body is a very dark brown/near black, off-white head fades quickly. Aroma - nose is nice and roasty, notable chocolate, creamy candy, ground coffee, bitter fruits. Palate/Flavour - body is full, medium-light, slick to start and tangy towards the end, again quite roasty, prominent coffee, bitter chocolate, tart cherry, cloying finish with bitter cherry and coffee.
beer_name: Black Oak Double Chocolate Cherry Stout

review_blob: Appearance - pours a nice deep golden/peach colour, fine bubbly white head. Aroma - lovely nose, big grapefruit, piney & resiny hops, candy, underlying grainy malt. Palate/Flavour - medium body is slick, yet sticky & cloying, grapefruit hops dominate, some caramel malt presence, cloying tart hoppy finish. Overall - a flavourful & worthy westcoast IPA

Appearence - body is clear, burnt orange colour, small off-white fine foamy head. Aroma - subtle nose has orange, honey, spices, hops. Palate/Flavour - body is fairly big, somewhat smooth, light, foamy/creamy mouthfeel, flavours like the nose, a bit toasty, cloves, lingering finish has citrus, cloves.

Appearence - very dark cola-brown body, light brown fine-foamy head. Aroma - nose has ripe dark fruits, candy sweetness, roasty tones, vinous, peat. Palate/Flavour - body is medium weight, creamy, slick, solid, roasty malts, creamy tones, peat, sugary fruit, lasting peaty finish.

Appearence - pours a slick jet black, small tan-couloured head. Aroma - awesome complex nose, roasty, with dark chocolate, dark fruits, scotch, molasses, touch of caramel, vanilla, peat, wood. Palate/Flavour - body is solid, slick, viscous, flavours of smoky peat, scotch, dark fruits, bitter chocolate, very long lasting toasty tart peaty finish. Overall - a fantastic brew, would like to try the 40 year version

Appearence - clear brassy orange body, thin white head. Aroma - nose is spicy, a good dose of pumpkin pie, cinnamon, cloves, a touch of lemony hops. Palate/Flavour - body is soft, slick, a bit watery, is spicy, pumpkin and spices, a bit bready, cloves linger in the finish.

Appearence - pours a murky caramel-coloured body, fine off-white head. Aroma - nose is very fragrant, full, malty, sugary, ripe fruits, vinous, caramel, toffee, hint of vanilla, oak, a bit of alcohol burn. Palate/Flavour - body has a medium-full presence, fine foamy/slick, flavours are mainly malty ripe fruits, very similar to the nose, overripe fruit (apple, pear) sticks in the finish. Overall - pretty malty for a tripel, does hide the 10% well.

Appearence - body is dark brown/laquered wood colour, small tan head fades quickly. Aroma - complex, full nose, bready, sugary, with port, wood, dates & figs, hint of bitter chocolate, presence of piney hops. Palate/Flavour - soft foamy meduim-full but light body, rich flavours of dark fruits, port, burnt caramel/toffee, spices, with a dark fruit/vinous finish. Overall - delicious, well deserving of its reputation

Appearence - pours a slick pitch black, with a mocha coloured head. Aroma - soft warm nose, a bit toasty, with ground coffee beans, port, ripe fruit, candy, a touch of wood, balanced with a good hop presence. Palate/Flavour - body is fairly full, but soft and creamy, flavours reflect the nose, coffee most prominent, fruit and bitter coffee in the finish. Overall - An excellent, very well-balanced beer, and very hard to believe its 13%!

Appearence - body is a foggy deep copper/red, with medium bubbly white head. Aroma - a lot in the nose, sharp, ripe fruits, vanilla, rye, caramel, spices, a touch of wood. Palate/Flavour - body is pretty solid, a bit fluffy, medium-full, flavours of fruits, spices, similar to the nose, overripe fruit and rye bite in the finish. Overall - another fine piece of work from Mikkeller, and a worthy tribute to Orval

Pint on draft at Chancey Smiths. Thanks again Milos! Appearance - clear golden/copper body, thin white head. Aroma - awesome nose dominated by huge citrus and pine hops, with candy, biscuit malts are somewhere in there. Palate & Flavour - body is fairly full and light, somewhat smooth, creamy, again the citrus and piney hops dominate, a touch of sweet malt, biscuit, with a lasting bitter pine finish. Overall - delicious, and very easy to drink for 8%. Cheers to Black Oak Brewing, and hopes that more Ontario breweries step it up!

For the first rating Im (finally) posting, one of my favorites. 
Appearance - pours a slick dark brown/near black, scant off-white head
Aroma - big awesome "desserty" nose, lots of toffee, vanilla, caramel, dark chocolate, a touch of port
Palate & Flavour - body is medium weight, solid, very slick, toasty, flavours reflect the nose, delicious and rich flavours, with creamy candy, a bit boozy, with a long lasting cloying toffeeish finish
Overall - Rich & delicious, like dessert in a glass
beer_name: Southern Tier Blackwater Series: Creme Brulee Stout
